titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas P. Boggess, Judgment
CWG4422

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Muhlenberg Circuit Court
Novr 9 1863
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Sums on Forefeited Recognizance as witness for Deft Courtis Simpson
Thomas P Boggess Deft

The defendant having been duly Summoned & failing to answer, It is adjudged by the Court that the Comth recovery said defendant T P Boggess fifty dollars that being the amount of his recognizance as a witness for the deft (the Comth vs J W Simpson & c) forefeited at the last term of this court and that he also pay the cost of the Summons
A Copy Att J. N. Reno Clk
The above is a copy of the Judgment which, F. P. Boggess has petd executive clemency
